description.full: @module storage
@type module:common/connection

code: var conn = require('../common/connection.js');

description.full: @type module:common/util

code: var util = require('../common/util.js');

description.full: Required scopes for Google Cloud Storage API.
description.summary: Required scopes for Google Cloud Storage API.

code: var SCOPES = ['https://www.googleapis.com/auth/devstorage.full_control'];

description.full: @const {string}

code: var STORAGE_BASE_URL = 'https://www.googleapis.com/storage/v1/b';

description.full: @const {string}

code: var STORAGE_UPLOAD_BASE_URL = 'https://www.googleapis.com/upload/storage/v1/b';

description.full:
Developer Documentation

Invoke this method to create a new Storage object bound with pre-determined
configuration options. For each object that can be created (e.g., a bucket),
there is an equivalent static and instance method. While they are classes,
they can be instantiated without use of the new keyword.
description.body:
Invoke this method to create a new Storage object bound with pre-determined
configuration options. For each object that can be created (e.g., a bucket),
there is an equivalent static and instance method. While they are classes,
they can be instantiated without use of the new keyword.

description.full:
To access your Cloud Storage buckets, you will use the bucket function
returned from this storage object.

The example below will demonstrate the different usage patterns your app may
need to connect to gcloud and access your bucket.
description.summary:
To access your Cloud Storage buckets, you will use the bucket function
returned from this storage object.
description.body:
The example below will demonstrate the different usage patterns your app may
need to connect to gcloud and access your bucket.

description.full:
Developer Documentation

Static method to create a Bucket without any pre-configured options.
description.body: Static method to create a Bucket without any pre-configured options.

code: Storage.bucket = Bucket;

description.full:
Developer Documentation

Instance method for creating a Bucket. Options configured at instantiation of
the Storage class will be passed through, allowing for overridden options
specified here.
description.body:
Instance method for creating a Bucket. Options configured at instantiation of
the Storage class will be passed through, allowing for overridden options
specified here.

tags.name: options.keyFilename
tags.description:
- Full path to the JSON key downloaded     from the Google Developers Console. Alternatively, you may provide a
    `credentials` object.

tags.name: options.credentials
tags.description: - Credentials object, used in place of     a `keyFilename`.

description.full: Create a Bucket object to interact with a Google Cloud Storage bucket.
description.summary: Create a Bucket object to interact with a Google Cloud Storage bucket.

tags.name: query.delimiter
tags.description:
- Results will contain only objects whose     names, aside from the prefix, do not contain delimiter. Objects whose
    names, aside from the prefix, contain delimiter will have their name
    truncated after the delimiter, returned in prefixes. Duplicate prefixes
    are omitted.

tags.name: query.prefix
tags.description: - Filters results to objects whose names begin     with this prefix.

tags.name: query.maxResults
tags.description: - Maximum number of items plus prefixes to     return.

tags.name: query.pageToken
tags.description: - A previously-returned page token     representing part of the larger set of results to view.

description.full: List files from the current bucket.
Stat a file.

tags.description: the destination filename is not provided.

tags.name: metadata.bucket
tags.description: - Destination bucket for the file. If none     is provided, the source's bucket name is used.

description.full:
Copy an existing file. If no bucket name is provided for the destination
file, the current bucket name will be used.
description.summary:
Copy an existing file. If no bucket name is provided for the destination
file, the current bucket name will be used.

tags.name: name
tags.description: - Name of the file to remove.

description.full: Remove a file.

tags.name: options.contentMd5
tags.description:
- The MD5 digest value in base64. If you     provide this, the client must provide this HTTP header with this same
    value in its request.

tags.name: options.contentType
tags.description: - If you provide this value, the client     must provide this HTTP header set to the same value.

tags.name: options.expires
tags.description: - Timestamp (seconds since epoch) when this     link will expire.

tags.name: options.extensionHeaders
tags.description: - If these headers are used, the     server will check to make sure that the client provides matching values.

description.full:
Get a signed URL to allow limited time access to a resource.

{@link https://developers.google.com/storage/docs/accesscontrol#Signed-URLs}
description.summary: Get a signed URL to allow limited time access to a resource.

description.full:
Create a readable stream to read contents of the provided remote file. It
can be piped to a write stream, or listened to for 'data' events to read a
file's contents.
description.summary:
Create a readable stream to read contents of the provided remote file. It
can be piped to a write stream, or listened to for 'data' events to read a
file's contents.

tags.name: name
tags.description: - Name of the remote file to create.

description.full: Create a duplex stream to handle the upload of a file.
description.summary: Create a duplex stream to handle the upload of a file.

tags.name: name
tags.description: - Name of the remote file to create.

tags.name: options.data
tags.description: - Data to save to the file.

description.full: Write the provided data to the destination with optional metadata.
description.summary: Write the provided data to the destination with optional metadata.

tags.name: name
tags.description: - The desired name of the file.

description.full: Get a remote stream to begin piping a readable stream to.
description.summary: Get a remote stream to begin piping a readable stream to.

description.full:
Make a new request object from the provided arguments and wrap the callback
to intercept non-successful responses.
description.summary:
Make a new request object from the provided arguments and wrap the callback
to intercept non-successful responses.
